reviews.review_msg: Sue's class was very engaging and enjoyable. She shared personal stories and allowed for lots of valuable discussion.

**THIS IS NOT FOR EDUC100 BUT EDUC376**

Professor Montabello is an amazing and caring professor who gives great feedback and motivates you to dig deep and think about the implications of education. She gave lenient due dates because she knows how difficult life can be for students. She is also easily reachable outside of class time.
One of the best professors I've had in my four years of undergrad at SFU.

What an amazing thesis supervisor! Her warm heart helps you find your passion. Wherever you journey takes you, she is their to support with everything shes got! She also has extensive educational change and leadership! Tens across the board!

Susan is one of the most caring professors at SFU. Her many years in the education system as a teacher and principal help her shine in her role as a professor. The assignments in this course are clearly laid out and students have the freedom to do them however they chose. Susan also gives very extensive feedback which helps you along the way.
Susan is an amazing professor, she is super engaging, gives great feedback, the class material is structured on your preference, you need to attend class for a good grade, she does not use canvas.
